Articles.Content:
If I want to plan some route and have two or more ways to do this - all involving more than one maneuver node - I'd like to find which will take least dV in total. But it only displays the dV of the first node. How can I get the summary dV or that of consecutive nodes on a given route?

(e.g. just today: Minmus orbit rendezvous: wait until my flyby passes through the plane of target's orbit, then turn and enter an orbit of the same plane, then circularize (cheaper turn, but more expensive braking) or shift the flyby path to be really close to Minmus, use Oberth effect for braking, then perform (expensive) plane change? Two nodes in both cases; one with cheap plane alignment, expensive capture, the other vice versa; sum of dV over both nodes is what matters).
If you "close" a future node (ie double-click away from it in map view), then hover the cursor over the closed node, it will tell you what its dV will be.
The precise node mod can tell you the dV of all placed nodes.

As Arkalius says, if you close the nodes you can mouse over and get info about them; eta, dV.

But it would be a nice convenience to have the sum of all nodes shown somewhere as a stock feature.
